common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS experiencing high RAM usage, CPU spikes, and connection issues. related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** High RAM usage by PiecesOS

**Key points raised:**

* PiecesOS can consume significant RAM, exceeding 5GB in some cases.
* This issue is particularly noticeable on Linux machines with Ubuntu 22.04 and 24.04.
* Some users experience high CPU usage alongside high RAM usage.
* High RAM usage has led some users to discontinue using PiecesOS.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS has a memory leak issue.
* Resource consumption is heavy due to on-device ML and Live Context features.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered individual support and a calendar link to troubleshoot memory issues.
* Rosie-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and highlighted upcoming improvements to optimize resource consumption. 
* An "Optimize Memory" option was added to unload unused ML models and free up RAM.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue persists, but the Pieces team is actively working on improvements.
* Users experiencing high resource consumption are advised to use the "Optimize Memory" option and contact support for further troubleshooting.
* Some users have discontinued using PiecesOS due to the issue.

**Overall, the conversation highlights the trade-off between on-device ML and resource consumption. While PiecesOS offers valuable features, its high resource usage remains a concern for some users.**

- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

* User @idiston reported a false positive detection of OSX/NukeSped.ext by Intego VirusBarrier in the Pieces OS application framework files.
* This has been observed before and is likely due to outdated virus definitions or a false positive in Intego's detection algorithms.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS app is flagged as malware by Intego VirusBarrier, causing concern for users and potentially impacting adoption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update Intego VirusBarrier to the latest virus definitions.
* Report the detection to Intego as a false positive.
* Temporarily trust the flagged files through Intego's interface.
* Pieces team will investigate the issue and test to reproduce it.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User is advised to try the recommended actions.
* The Pieces team will investigate further and update the user/community on the outcome.

**Additional Notes:**

* Numerous resources were provided by the support team for further assistance.
* The issue appears to be specific to Intego VirusBarrier and not other antivirus software. 
* The Pieces team has acknowledged the issue and is working to resolve it.

**Reduce Rate Limiting Issues:** Review and refine rate limiting mechanisms in PiecesOS to minimize errors and functionality loss for users, particularly those relying on cloud processing.

**Enhance Error Messaging and Troubleshooting:** Provide clearer error messages to users and improve documentation regarding PiecesOS connectivity, performance, and plugin issues to facilitate self-resolution.
**Proactively Address Antivirus Conflicts:** Collaborate with antivirus vendors to address false positive detections of Pieces OS updates and minimize disruptions for users.

**Gather User Feedback on LTM:** Investigate and address issues related to the Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature, including difficulty enabling it and inconsistencies in model saving, based on user feedback.

**Optimize Onboarding and Installation:** Improve the clarity and user-friendliness of the PiecesOS installation process, addressing issues encountered on specific macOS versions and providing alternative installation methods.
**Monitor Specific Windows Builds:** Pay close attention to issues reported on specific Windows builds, such as Build 26100, to identify and address potential platform-specific conflicts.

**Review and Update Documentation:** Ensure all support documentation, including troubleshooting guides, is up-to-date and covers common issues like port conflicts, antivirus interference, and LTM usage.

**Consider a Bug Bounty Program:** Implement a bug bounty program to incentivize security researchers and users to identify and report vulnerabilities, potentially reducing the impact of future issues like the antivirus false positive.
